remarks: Any _finite_ number of elements in a directed set have a common upper bound.  Here is where the non-emptiness constraint in ~ df-drs first comes into play; without it we would need an additional constraint that ` X ` not be empty.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)
statement:
drsbn0.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
drsdirfi.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
drsdirfi $p |- ( ( K e. Dirset /\ X C_ B /\ X e. Fin ) -> E. y e. B A. z e. X z .<_ y ) $.
$d .<_ y z $.
$d B y z $.
$d K y z $.
$d X y z $.
